title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 6.12 - Bottles for testing by the babcock or gerber method
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 6.12 - Bottles for testing by the babcock or gerber method

State Regulations

All universal samples shall be tested in bottles that are
graduated in one-tenth of one percent intervals, with each whole percent
interval having significantly greater prominence then the one-tenth of one
percent intervals. All bottles shall be graduated from zero to eight percent
and shall hold a sufficient amount of milk so that the test to be done on such
milk may be accurately performed. No bottle shall be used unless examined by
the commissioner and approved and branded by him. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1
ยง
6.12

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
